The Film

Andy Garcia (Modigliani) stars and makes his directorial debut in a passionate and historical tribute to his native Cuba. Havana in 1958 is a place of pleasure for many, but others are not happy under the rule of dictator Fulgencio Batista. As the revolutionary forces of Fidel Castro and Ernesto ÃƒÂ¢??CheÃƒÂ¢?? Guevara prepare to move on the city, Fico Fellove (Garcia)owner of the cityÃƒÂ¢??s classiest music nightclub, El Tropico struggles to hold together his family and the love of a woman (InÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©s Sastre), not knowing that his club will become more than just a stage for popular entertainment. Observing all is The Writer (Bill Murray) an expatriate American who sees Fico being drawn into events as the revolution changes everything. Though Fico watches a culture vanish and a people transformed, it is his love of Cuban music that keeps his memories alive. Co starring Dustin Hoffman and Steven Bauer. Written by Cuban novelist Guillermo Cabrera Infante..
